summary.title: New Threat Model
summary.description: From the network infrastructure of my home

threats.title: Cellphone Tampering
threats.description: Someone intending to impersonate the phone user and having access to it can open one of the phone's applications and pretend to be that person by sending a message or performing other actions.
threats.mitigation: Utilize biometric data and set up a password to access the phone and important applications. Additionally, it is crucial not to share passwords with other users.

threats.title: Cellphone Information disclosure
threats.description: Someone who wants to share data from the phone or that is stored on it.
threats.mitigation: Use passwords or biometric data to access the mobile phone and the applications where sensitive information is stored.

threats.title: Cellphone DoS
threats.description: Someone with the intention of blocking access to the phone.
threats.mitigation: Configure the phone to prevent it from locking after a certain number of attempts and physically protect the device.

threats.title: Laptop Tampering
threats.description: Someone intending to impersonate the laptop user and having access to it can open one of the laptop's applications and pretend to be that person by sending a message or performing other actions.
threats.mitigation: Set up a password or use biometric data to access the computer, as well as critical applications.

threats.title: Laptop Information disclosure
threats.description: Someone who wants to share data from the laptop or that is stored on it.
threats.mitigation: Use passwords or biometric data to access the laptop and the applications where sensitive information is stored.

threats.title: Cellphone DoS
threats.description: Someone with the intention of blocking access to the laptop.
threats.mitigation: Configure the laptop to prevent it from locking after a certain number of attempts and physically protect the device, as well as block the ports that are not in use.

threats.title: PC Tampering
threats.description: Someone intending to impersonate the PC user and having access to it can open one of the PC's applications and pretend to be that person by sending a message or performing other actions.
threats.mitigation: Set up a password or use biometric data to access the PC, as well as critical applications.

threats.title: PC Information disclosure
threats.description: Someone who wants to share data from the PC or that is stored on it.
threats.mitigation: Use passwords or biometric data to access the PC and the applications where sensitive information is stored.

threats.title: PC DoS
threats.description: Someone with the intention of blocking access to the PC.
threats.mitigation: Configure the PC to prevent it from locking after a certain number of attempts and physically protect the device, as well as block the ports that are not in use.

threats.title: TV Information disclosure
threats.description: An individual with access to the televisions and the intention to steal account credentials such as Netflix, YouTube, etc., can turn on the television and obtain those credentials.
threats.mitigation: Set up a password to access the television and close unused ports to prevent the connection of devices that could manipulate the equipment.

threats.title: Wireless Ap Tampering
threats.description: Any external or internal individual with malicious intent seeking to tamper with, damage, or interfere with the exchange of information within the internal network.
threats.mitigation: The device is kept in a concealed location to prevent unauthorized changes. Unoccupied router ports are disabled to avoid physical connections that could lead to configuration changes.

threats.title: Wireless Ap Information disclosure
threats.description: Anyone with malicious intent intending to share data from the Wireless AP device.
threats.mitigation: The device is kept in a concealed location to facilitate device changes. Unoccupied router ports are disabled to prevent physical connections that could lead to configuration changes.

threats.title: Wireless AP DoS
threats.description: Anyone with malicious intentions aiming to disrupt the services provided by the Wireless AP.
threats.mitigation: Unoccupied router ports are disabled to prevent physical connections that could overwhelm the system.

threats.title: Switch Tampering
threats.description: Anyone with malicious intent who wants to change, delete, or interfere with the collection of information within the network.
threats.mitigation: The device is in a hidden place for device change.

threats.title: Switch Information disclosure
threats.description: Any person with malicious intentions who wants to disclose information about the switch.
threats.mitigation: Any information about the default credentials, model, or version of the product has been obscured. The device is concealed in a secure location to prevent unauthorized access and prevent untimely alterations.

threats.title: Switch DoS
threats.description: Any person with malicious intentions who seeks to disrupt the services provided by the switch.
threats.mitigation: Unoccupied switch ports are disabled to prevent physical connections that could overwhelm the system.

threats.title: PC Tampering
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: Router Tampering
threats.description: Any person with malicious intentions who wants to change, delete, or interrupt the traffic of the router.
threats.mitigation: The router has a password different from the default, and it is changed periodically for security purposes.

threats.title: Router Information disclosure
threats.description: Anyone who wants to share the credentials or technical aspects of the router.
threats.mitigation: The label containing the router's default credentials, as well as any text revealing the type and version of the router, has been removed.

threats.title: Router DoS
threats.description: Anyone who wants to deny the service offered by the router.
threats.mitigation: The wiring is protected, and we have control over the people who are connected to the internal network through Nmap.

data.name: Microsoft cloud
data.description: A device that  permitted and prohibited web activity in a private network.
data.reasonOutOfScope: It is not a fully user-controlled device.

threats.title: MCloud Spoofing
threats.description: Someone who wants to impersonate someone else with the intention of gaining unauthorized access or carrying out malicious activities.
threats.mitigation: MFA enabled

threats.title: MCloud Tampering
threats.description: Someone attempting to alter, upload, or delete information stored in the cloud or the traffic between the user and the cloud.
threats.mitigation: Users do not share their passwords and use different passwords for each account.

threats.title: MCloud Repudiantion
threats.description: Someone who tries to claim they did not receive something when they actually did.
threats.mitigation: Only use applications or software that ensure non-repudiation.

threats.title: MCloud Information disclosure
threats.description: Someone who wants to spread private information with malicious intentions.
threats.mitigation: Maintain cloud sharing controls so that only the owners can view the information.

threats.title: MCloud DoS
threats.description: Someone who wants to deny the service provided by the cloud.
threats.mitigation: It does not depend on the user, as the infrastructure and control are managed by the company.

threats.title: MCloud EoP
threats.description: Someone who wants to elevate their user privileges to carry out malicious actions.
threats.mitigation: It does not depend on the user, as the infrastructure and control are managed by the company.
